inlineContent.text: For an overview of how event value types work (such as note velocity, CC value, etc.) see

abstract.text: Channel Voice events include notes, continuous controllers, pressure (aftertouch), program changes, and registered parameters (RPN/NRPN). Additional per-note controllers are available when communicating with a device that supports MIDI 2.0.
System Real-Time events include global system messages such as sequencer start/stop/continue, timing clock, and system reset.
also referred to as Assignable Controller in MIDI 2.0.

also referred to as Registered Controller in MIDI 2.0.

MIDIKit umbrella import that includes all MIDIKit modules.
To increase type safety and enforce value validation, novel value types have been implemented in MIDIKit.
Channel Voice Message: NRPN (Non-Registered Parameter Number),
also referred to as Assignable Controller in MIDI 2.0.
Determines whether a message is an RPN (registered) or an NRPN (assignable).
Assembles a MIDI 1.0 NRPN compound message, consisting of multiple CC events.

System Common events include general system messages such as song select and MIDI Timecode (MTC) quarter-frame. These messages are not channel-specific.
also referred to as Registered Controllers in MIDI 2.0.
Assembles a MIDI 1.0 RPN compound message, consisting of multiple CC events.
MIDI 2.0 Parameter Number value change type.
Determines whether an RPN/NRPN messages value is absolute or a relative change.
Channel Voice Message: NRPN (Non-Registered Parameter Number),
also referred to as Assignable Controller in MIDI 2.0.

System Exclusive messages carry a header and an arbitrary number of data bytes. These messages are typically used to communicate patch and preset data or binary data payloads such as raw audio samples or device firmware updates. It is up to each software or hardware manufacturer to determine how the data is formatted.
Standard MIDI File extension for MIDIKit.

also referred to as Registered Controller in MIDI 2.0.
The MIDI 2.0 Spec provides a set of UMP transport-related utility messages, including jitter-reduction messages to help improve event timing.
